notes: On 26 June 2020, Rwandan military forces clashed with around 100 unidentified armed gunmen from Burundi near the Ruheru military position (Nyaruguru, Southern Province). 4 of the unidentified group, carrying official Burundian military equipment, were killed, 3 captured and others fled back to Gihisi, Burundi. 3 Rwandan soldiers were injured.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy (Uranana Faction)
notes: On 3 and 4 December 2019, FDLR-RUD forces were alleged to have engaged in clashes in Kinigi sector (Northern Province, coordinates for Kinigi used at geoprec2) after crossing from the DRC, with unspecified Rwandan security forces (presumed to be army) killing 'many' and capturing several rebels (3 fatalities coded pending further information). Rwandan authorities claimed that Uganda was involved in organising the violence.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy (Uranana Faction)

Rwandan authorities claimed that Uganda was involved in organising the violence.

On 14 November 2019, an unidentified armed group once again attacked Rwanda army positions on the Burundi-Rwanda border in the Kibira-Nyungwe forest (coordinates for Nyungwe Forest, Western Province, used at geoprec2). The Burundian attackers may be RED-TABARA and FRODEBU forces, although this is unconfirmed (actor1 coded as UAG). The sources make no mention of casualties.

On 7 and 8 November 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked Rwanda army positions on the Burundi-Rwanda border in the Kibira-Nyungwe forest (coordinates for Nyungwe Forest, Western Province, used at geoprec2). The Burundian attackers may be RED-TABARA and FRODEBU forces, although this is unconfirmed (actor1 coded as UAG). The sources make no mention of casualties.

08 November 2019. An unidentified armed group clashed with Rwanda military forces on the Burundi-Rwanda border in the Kibira-Nyungwe forest. Sources say the clash happened on the Rwanda side of the border. These are likely RED-TABARA and FRODEBU forces which have been fighting in Burundi. No fatalities reported in the clash.

On 7 and 8 November 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked Rwanda army positions on the Burundi-Rwanda border in the Kibira-Nyungwe forest (coordinates for Nyungwe Forest, Western Province, used at geoprec2). The Burundian attackers may be RED-TABARA and FRODEBU forces, although this is unconfirmed (actor1 coded as UAG). The sources make no mention of casualties.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy (Uranana Faction)
notes: On or around October 5th, Rwandan security forces (coded here as army) reportedly killed 19 members and arrested 5 members of the group responsible for the Oct 4th attack on Kinigi (which authorities have identified as a splinter faction of the FDLR named RUD-Uranana). Information about the event(s) is limited; one event coded at time prec2 and geoprec2, using Kinigi (Northern Province) as the location.

On July 9th, prisoners at Nyarugenge (Kigali) demonstrated against community services activities. Authorities reported a small number of protesters (who have subsequently been charged) were attempting to incite other prisoners. [size=28]

On December 16th or 17th, RDF soldiers intercepted the unidentified armed group which had attacked Cyitabi sector on December 15th. The interception occurred in Nyamagabe, close to the border with Burundi. Three attackers were killed by the RDF according to a military press statement, and 74 civilians who had been abducted on Dec 15th were rescued. The army said the remaining attackers fled into Burundi. UPDATE: the FLN rebel movement has subsequently declared responsibility for the attacks in the area, and the ensuing clashes with Rwandan soldiers.

actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09 December. DRC-based FDLR rebels attacked a base of the Rwanda military forces in Cyamabuye. The attack was repulsed, four FDLR rebels killed and at least two RDF soldiers. An injured civilian was rushed to the hospital.
26 November. Thousands of protesters marched in Kigali against gender-based violence. The march was part of state-organized days against gender-based violence
On 3 June, hundreds of Rwandans marched in Kigali to encourage the public to address plastic pollution. The march was organised by the Ministry of Environment.

Rwandan police and military opened fire on a group of Congolese refugees protesting outside the UN offices in Kiziba/Karongi Refugee Camp. 11 refugees were killed in the gunfire and another 20 were injured. 7 police officers were injured by the crowd. 15 refugees have been arrested for staging illegal demonstrations.

Congolese refugees in the Karongi Refugee Camp held a two-day sit-in outside the UN offices in Kiziba/Karongi refugee camp. They are angry about a recent reduction in food assistance and are demanding resettlement.

Police attempted to arrest suspected Islamic militants, and when they 'turned violent' they shot and killed three. Three others arrested.
Police killed Islamist militant in a three hour shoot-out.

Hundreds of angry students protested on the streets of Kigali, shouting anti-BBC slogans. The protesters marched to the Parliament buildings and handed a petition demanding readdress for the BBC documentary 'Rwandas Untold Story' and then marched to the BBC offices in Kigali. Two student groups, AERG and FAGER organied the protest.

notes: Hutu rebels attack jail at Mutura, freeing 402 prisoners.
Genocide survivors demonstrate peacefully against release of genocide suspects.
More than 300 people were killed when a large gang of Hutu rebels attacked a jail in northwestern Rwanda in a bid to free hundreds of their colleagues.
More than 300 people were killed when a large gang of Hutu rebels attacked a jail in northwestern Rwanda in a bid to free hundreds of their colleagues.
2 day protests by genocide survivors over the release of genocide suspects. (led to the redetainment of come of the suspects).
More than 300 people were killed when a large gang of Hutu rebels attacked a jail in northwestern Rwanda in a bid to free hundreds of their colleagues.
2 day protests by genocide survivors over the release of genocide suspects. (led to the redetainment of come of the suspects).
Armed militia attack the detention center of Giveye commune. They engaged with the Rwandese armed forces. 80 prisoners were killed in the crossfire, while 90 managed to escape.
200-300 people (estimated) killed in an attack on a prison and the military operation that followed. 1,000 Hutu rebels attacked Giciye prison. 88 prisoners and 100 rebels killed.
Demonstrators gather in protest of the release of seven people from prison. The residents claim that the released people killed their people and committed crimes of genocide
Mid-october- machine gunfire and mortars in Gisenyi near the airport.

15 armed infiltrators killed by Rwandan armed forces in Byumba. The incident occurred when security forces and the population of Kibali, Cyungo and Cyumba communes tried to dislodge armed infiltrators.
RPA soldiers and insurgents exchanged fire in the crowded market of Mahoko. Reportedly, some 400 unarmed civilians were killed in the cross-fire although the RPA disputed the number.
Security forces killed 4 infiltrators, including a notorious criminal, the leader of the gang, Rukunjira [phonetic], alias Shomeri [phonetic].
Army clashes with 30 ex-FAR soldiers after they were spotted by local population in Kagenda and Kavumu localities of Cyabingo. 10 ex-FAR were killed.

The Rwandan army flushed out and routed Interahamwe [Hutu extremist] militiamen who had tried to establish a base in the sectors of Gacaca, Cyove [and] Gisanze in Kigombe commune, and Kigarama in neighbouring Ruhondo. The army killed 100 Interhamwe milit

The Rwandan army flushed out and routed Interahamwe [Hutu extremist] militiamen who had tried to establish a base in the sectors of Gacaca, Cyove [and] Gisanze in Kigombe commune, and Kigarama in neighbouring Ruhondo. The army killed 100 Interhamwe milit

The Rwandan army flushed out and routed Interahamwe [Hutu extremist] militiamen who had tried to establish a base in the sectors of Gacaca, Cyove [and] Gisanze in Kigombe commune, and Kigarama in neighbouring Ruhondo. The army killed 100 Interhamwe milit
100 Interhamwe militia and ex-FAR soldiers kill 5 and wound 10. They were then repulsed by the army.
Former senior army officer, Maj Bahemba killed in clashes between Rwandan Patriotic Army, (RPA), and a former Rwandan army (ex-FAR) forces. (50 other ex- FAR killed in clash as well.)
Ex-FAR and Interhamwe militia kill 3 soldiers near Katale.
4 unidentified armed men killed in clashes with security forces.
Security forces and unidentified armed men clash in Nyakinama in Ruhengeri.

5 people killed in clashes between Rwandan security forces and Hutu militias in Runda village in Gitaerama District. Reports state that the rebels were a combination of ex-Armed forces of Rwanda and Interhamwe Hutu Militias
Two unidentified armed men killed in fire exchange with security forces in Gusave.
Rwandan security forces kill 6 Hutu infiltrators trying to escape where they were held in Runda Commune.

Government soldiers clashed with unidentified armed men. Armed men then hid for 10 days intending to free prisoners from the communal prison of Nkumba [phonetic] and force leaders to give them identity cards.

Government soldiers clashed with unidentified armed men. Armed men then hid for 10 days intending to free prisoners from the communal prison of Nkumba [phonetic] and force leaders to give them identity cards.
Security forces kill a rebel officer who had been disrupting security in the region of Cyangugu.
